instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.ALL_SYS: What is ALL_SYS? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALL_SYS, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b quarter fan spin
threads.message:
HI, I have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with missing resistor all over the board ( maybe previous techinician mess this up )
so i place all missing resistor I can see, plug in magsafe., and the fan turn on for 1 second and then stop
ppbus 12.6v
pp3v42 3.3v
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.3v
I try to reflow smc, and then i got dim green light with fan running at max instead
tried to reball instead, but the smc pad at pin 156 <SIGNAL>NC_SMC_T25_EN_L</SIGNAL> is missing, and I don't see this pad go anywhere on boardview, any idea ? or should i ignore this line ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b quarter fan spin
threads.message:
"NC" stands from Not Connected; so don't bother with that line.

Which voltages and signals do you get now?
